history.text: Hi, have you seen Iron Man? It's a great movie that came out in 2008!
Apparently.  I have never heard of Robert Downey before this film.
I enjoyed this film.  I was glad they made sequels.
He did an awesome job playing Tony Stark.
In many ways, I think the success of this movie was instrumental in the success of the Marvel franchise.
At least in film.
I never really cared about comics until this film was released.
It was a good kick off to the universe. I think a lot of people started caring about Marvel after this one.
Yeah, definiely.  Certainly separated themselves well from DC as well.  I also liked Gwyneth Paltrow as Pepper.  She added such a great contrast to Downey's character.
Yes. I don't usually like her, but Pepper is a fun character when she gets to be.
Indeed.  As a car guy, I loved this film too for the random collection they showed off a few times throughout the movie.
I thought it was weird that they didn't continue with Terrence Howard for the subsequent films.
The replacement, I forget his name, made it a bit confusing with Iron Man 2 and 3
Yeah, Terrence Howard was good as Rhodes.
Yeah, I felt he brought a bit more clout to the film.
Were you much of a comics fan before the films?
No, I never had the patience to watch the stories play out over time. A movie is the perfect story length for me.
Exactly!  And it simplifies a lot of details so that you don't have to know all of the backstories.
That's where the current series with Infinity War and whatnot is losing me somewhat.  Can't follow all the details
What did you think of Shaun Toub in this film?
I was impressed at how Yinsen put together the electromagnet to keep the shrapnel from Stark's heart. I would like to have seen more of him.
Yeah, that detail was an interesting dynamic as he helped the genius inventor.
And then that grafting becomes the integral part to Iron Man's story.
I thought Jeff Bridges was a great addition to this story too.
Yeah--I always forget that that the basis for Iron Man comes from the other guy he was imprisoned with.
He's such a dynamic actor and I rather liked seeing him as the bad guy
I thought he was pretty one-dimensional as a bad guy--I would have like to see a bit more depth.
But I guess that's the price you pay for getting a comic book story in movie format.

Hmm, I guess that's true.  Somewhat predictable.  Though,I 
 think they may have been pressed for time, too.
The F-22 scene was awesome.  Especially since he didn't quite know how to use his suite especially efficiently yet.
suit*
Oh, and Phil Coulson... love that guy.
Yeah, I enjoy all of the scenes that show his learning curve with the suit. I could have watched a whole movie just of that.
I know, right.  The orientation scenes where the heroes learn their abilities are always entertaining.
And it's good to see that even his isn't perfect the first time around.
Oh, when Stark has to use his old reactor that Pepper had gifted him.  That was a cool touch
Indeed
That was pretty dramatic towards the end. It's a good thing she kept it.
The highway fight between Stark and Stane was cool.  That bus implosion!
Definitely
I like how they, Stark and Potts, are always working together throughout this movie.
They make a sweet and cool team together
They do. I think sometimes she is treated as less capable than she really is, but it's mostly fun to watch them.
